subject: Dear Burton
body:
Dear  Burton

Good day . We are in receipt of your mail  dated  9Th    Feb    2024 and we
have taken note of your mail ,before we sign the MoU  you need to indicate
 your  clients business plan and  we are ready to finance all
their  projects .

Sir, our Deal sizes up to $100.000:00 Minimum Funding --- $500,000,000
Maximum Funding * Rates as low as 2% both home and
overseas. * 3-25 year terms * Broker friendly * Closing typically in under
7-14 workings day * for either personal or business loans,

Find attached  the company  Loan  Application  form. Go ahead  and  give it
to your client  to complete the form and send it back to us so that we will
be able to give you the loan calculation and our terms and conditions.
Including the loan repayment plan
.
I appreciate your genuineness as well
in your work with us. I would like to inform you that we do have incentives
for you for every successful client that meets our approval requirements.

We would approve a 5% finder's fee on every loan approved for payment as
your commission. We urge you to work with us so we can build a lasting
business relationship.

*Note* the Insurance Premium fee is always calculated on the total Loan
Fund your client requested  speciall;y when the client do not have
collateral security here in the United Kingdom ,

Yes you are free to increase the Interest rate But the least we can offer
you for now is 2%  What ever interest rate you add just indicate to us in
your next mail

As we progress with the loan application process  we will give you the
insurance company contact ,


Regards,

Mr Paul  McCann
Capital Funding One Limite
Cheshire House Gorsey Lane.
Widnes Cheshire
England  WA8 ORP UK
WHATApp  No +44 7407649394


lu12034@***.com




Hello,

Thank you for reaching out and Happy New Year to you too! Your loan options
sound quite interesting. I'm curious, could you please elaborate more on
the flexible financing solutions that your company offers?

Also, I would like to know more about the role of a broker in this context.
What exactly would my responsibilities be?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.
Best wishes,
Burton

subject: Re: Dear Burton
body:
Hello Mr. Paul,

Thank you for your detailed response and the information about Capital Funding One Limited's loan options. It sounds like a great opportunity!

I'm interested in understanding more about the process. Could you please explain how the Insurance Premium fee is calculated? And what does it mean when you say it's based on the total Loan Fund requested, especially when there's no collateral security?

Also, I'm intrigued by the role of a broker that you mentioned. What would be my responsibilities and benefits in this position? 

Lastly, could you provide more details about the incentives for successful clients? It sounds like an exciting prospect!

Looking forward to your response.

Best wishes,
Burton

subject: Dear Burton
body:
Dear Burton

Thanks for your mail  Inrespect to your question  the  Insurance premium
 fee is determined by the total loan fund your clients needed
The Insurance fee for one Million  Dollars  will cost $24,500 USD   which
will be shared  in a ratio of 505  between  the  Lender and borrower
and must be paid to the insurance  company  before the board od directors
pf loan company  approved the loan fund for transfer .

Sir you will  approve a 5% finder's fee on every loan approved for payment
as your commission. We urge you to work with us so we can build a lasting
business relationship. and  you are free to increase the Interest rate But
the least we can offer you for now is 2%  What ever interest rate you add
just indicate to us in your next mail


Thanks for your Understanding

subject: Re: Dear Burton
body:
Hello Burton,

Thank you for your detailed response. It's quite interesting to learn about the insurance premium fee and how it is determined by the total loan fund needed by clients. The sharing ratio between the lender and borrower also seems fair.

I'm curious, could you please explain a bit more about how the finder's fee works? How is it calculated and when is it approved for payment?

Also, I appreciate your flexibility regarding the interest rate. Could you provide some guidance on what would be a reasonable increase in the interest rate?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Burton

subject: Re: Dear Burton
body:
Hello Burton,

Thank you for your detailed response. It's interesting to learn about the insurance premium fee and how it is determined by the total loan fund needed by clients. The sharing ratio between the lender and borrower also sounds fair.

I'm curious, could you please explain a bit more about how the finder's fee works? And when you mention increasing the interest rate, what factors should I consider before deciding on this?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Burton

subject: Dear Burton
body:
Dear Burton

Thank you for the email.   I took note of your email. A commission given to
an intermediary or of a transaction. The board of directors determines the
finder's fee, which is typically 5% of the transaction's profit made after
successful transaction
We recommend drafting an MFPA agreement for both parties to sign,
outlining our terms and conditions for you as our broker. Please provide
the following information.

Note  you are free to increase the Interest rate But the least we can offer
you for now is 2% What ever interest rate you add just indicate to us in
your next mail


Name ..................

Your Company Name:.. (IF Any(

Address :......................

Phone Number;.....................

Any form of your Valid ID card
..
Your Bank Details   were you want  your commission transfer to

Bank  Name...........................

Bank Address ..................

Account  Name .....................

Account Number ..........................

Swift Code .....................................
or
Iban No...............................


Wait to receive the above information

Thanks for your cooperation .


Mr Paul  McCann
Capital Funding One

subject: Re: Dear Burton
body:
Hello Mr. Paul,

Thank you for your prompt response and the detailed information about the finder's fee and the MFPA agreement. It sounds like a good opportunity.

I'm curious, could you please explain more about how the board of directors determines the finder's fee? And what is typically included in the terms and conditions for brokers?

As for the interest rate, I appreciate your flexibility. Could you provide some guidance on what would be a reasonable increase?

Regarding your request for personal details, I am sorry but I am not comfortable sharing such sensitive information over email due to security reasons. Is there another way we can proceed with this?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Burton
